summary: The 'Stopping High-level Record Elimination and Destruction Act of 2025' (SHRED Act of 2025) aims to increase penalties for officials within the Department of Justice and the intelligence community who conceal, remove, or mutilate government records. The bill proposes that such offenses result in imprisonment of at least 20 years or life, along with potential fines, amending Title 18 of the United States Code.
